description: From French néologisme, from Ancient Greek νέος (néos, “new”) + λόγος (lógos, “word”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics, lexicography, countable) A word or phrase which has recently been coined; a new word or phrase, or an existing one which has gained a new meaning.
(linguistics, uncountable) The act or instance of coining, or uttering a new word.
(psychiatry) The newly coined, meaningless words or phrases of someone with a psychosis, usually schizophrenia.
The introduction of new doctrine, for example in theology.
